name: Masonry Hammer
description: A masonry hammer is shaped like a claw hammer, having a longer handle and a head, but that is where the similarity stops. The masonry hammers head is also two-sided

name: Trowel
description: A trowel is a small pie-shaped tool that is attached to a small handle. It is used to pick up mortar and spread it onto the brick you are about to put in place.

name: Masonry Saws
description: The masonry hand saw looks a lot like a standard hand saw, but it has longer blades and larger teeth. The blade on this saw is only six to seven inches tall

name: Power Saw
description: These saws can either be handheld or mounted to a table and used like a table saw. The table saw makes the cleanest cuts that you can get.

name: Masonry Square
description: The masonry square looks like a standard square, but it is usually made of wood or plastic. The square is used at the corner of two perpendicular walls

name: Masons Level
description: The masons level looks like a standard level, but it is usually made out of wood or plastic and is very lightweight. These levels, like standard levels, have vials in them

name: Tape Measure
description: Tape measures are used to measure out where your walls begin and end, or how large an opening is meant to be.
